intro: Borreria loretiana, commonly known as Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Borreria loretiana is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, often in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
